title: Southie man convicted of killing neighborhood woman - Massachusetts
text:
BOSTON (AP) — A Boston man has been convicted of killing a 67-year-old grandmother and family friend during a quest for money to buy drugs.
A jury on Friday found 30-year-old Timothy Kostka (KOSS'-kuh) guilty of first-degree murder for the April 2012 killing of Barbara Coyne in her South Boston home.
 Prosecutors say Kostka broke into Coyne’s home and was rummaging through a jewelry box whe she walked in on him. They say he beat her and cut her throat, before making off with some winning lottery tickets which he cashed for money to buy heroin.
Authorities say Kostka’s and Coyne’s families knew each other.
Investigators found Kostka’s fingerprints on Coyne’s jewelry boxes and his DNA was under her fingernails.
Kostka faces a mandatory term of life in prison without parole.
